ygData.msgSnippet: Hello all- What population sizes to you typically use for NEAT? We have done experiments in the Avida digital evolution platform that suggest that below 1,000

X-Yahoo-Profile: jeffreyclune

Hello all-

What population sizes to you typically use for NEAT?

We have done experiments in the Avida digital evolution platform that
suggest that below 1,000 org drift starts to play a role. But a lot of the
HyperNEAT papers use pop sizes of 150 or so. My guess is that the diversity
preserving measure ('speciation') and elitism help make smaller populations
effective, but I was wondering if anyone has looked at the effects of
population size in NEAT in an effort to provide a *rough but general*
suggestion as to how big to make the populations in NEAT.




Cheers,
Jeff Clune

Digital Evolution Lab, Michigan State University

jclune@...
